Package com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    StochasticComponent
    A parent interface for layers which should be "shuffled" often, generally when the layer has some random noise-determining state.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbsActivationLayer
    The Absolute Value.
    AssertDimensionsLayer
    This layer is a pass-thru except that it throws an error if the dimensions are not consistent with its setting.
    AvgImageBandLayer
    Reduces each band of an image to its average (arithmetic mean) value.
    AvgImageBandLayer.IndexMapKey
    The type Index map key.
    AvgMetaLayer
    Computes the average value for each element across all elements of an execution batch.
    AvgReducerLayer
    Computes the average value across all elements of each input tensor.
    AvgSubsampleLayer
    The type Avg subsample layer.
    AvgSubsampleLayer.IndexMapKey
    The type Index map key.
    BiasLayer
    Adds a bias tensor to the input.
    BiasMetaLayer
    The type Bias meta layer.
    BinaryEntropyActivationLayer
    The type Binary entropy activation layer.
    BinaryNoiseLayer
    The type Binary noise layer.
    ConstNNLayer
    This layer does not require any input, and produces a constant output.
    CrossDifferenceLayer
    The type Cross difference layer.
    CrossDotMetaLayer
    The type Cross dot meta layer.
    CrossProductLayer
    The type Cross product layer.
    DropoutNoiseLayer
    Randomly selects a fraction of the inputs and sets all other elements to zero.
    EntropyLayer
    The type Entropy layer.
    EntropyLossLayer
    An entropy-based cost function.
    FullyConnectedLayer
    A dense matrix operator using vector-matrix multiplication.
    GaussianActivationLayer
    This activation layer uses the unit gaussian curve.
    GaussianNoiseLayer
    Adds uniform random gaussian noise to all input elements.
    HyperbolicActivationLayer
    This activation layer uses a parameterized hyperbolic function.
    ImgBandBiasLayer
    Adds a per-color-band value offset to the single tensor input.
    ImgBandScaleLayer
    Scales the input using per-color-band coefficients
    ImgBandSelectLayer
    Selects specific color bands from the input, producing an image with the same resolution but fewer bands.
    ImgConcatLayer
    Concatenates two or more images with the same resolution so the output contains all input color bands.
    ImgCropLayer
    Reduces the resolution of the input by selecting a centered window.
    ImgReshapeLayer
    Reduces or expands image resolution by rearranging the values in NxN tiles to effectively stripe the small-scale spacial dimension across N^2 color bands.
    L1NormalizationLayer
    Normalizes the input so that the L1 magnitude (ie sum of abs) is 1.
    LinearActivationLayer
    A tunable linear (y=A*x+B) function, whose parameters can participate in learning.
    LogActivationLayer
    A y=log(abs(x)) activation function.
    LoggingWrapperLayer
    This wrapper adds a highly verbose amount of logging to System.out detailing all inputs and outputs during forward and backwards evaluation.
    MaxConstLayer
    Enforces a maximum-value constraint on the input signal, rounding down any values exceeding a setByCoord threshold.
    MaxDropoutNoiseLayer
    Selects the maximum value in each NxN cell, setting all other values to zero.
    MaxImageBandLayer
    Selects the highest value in each color band, emitting a 1x1xN tensor.
    MaxImageBandLayer.CalcRegionsParameter
    The type Calc regions parameter.
    MaxMetaLayer
    The type Max meta layer.
    MaxSubsampleLayer
    The type Max subsample layer.
    MaxSubsampleLayer.CalcRegionsParameter
    The type Calc regions parameter.
    MeanSqLossLayer
    An RMS-differencing loss function without the final square root.
    MonitoringSynapse
    A diagnostic pass-through layer that collects value statistics of forward and backprop signals.
    MonitoringWrapperLayer
    A diagnostic wrapper that collects performance data and, if enabled, value statistics of output and backprop signals.
    NormalizationMetaLayer
    The type Normalization meta layer.
    NthPowerActivationLayer
    A multi-purpose Nth-power exponential function.
    PlaceholderLayer<T>
    An ephemeral, non-serializable, non-evaluatable layer.
    ProductInputsLayer
    Multiplies all inputs together, element-by-element.
    ProductLayer
    The type Product layer.
    ReLuActivationLayer
    Rectified Linear Unit.
    RescaledSubnetLayer
    This layer works as a scaling function, similar to a father wavelet.
    ScaleMetaLayer
    The type Scale meta layer.
    SigmoidActivationLayer
    The classic activation function, either "sigmoid" or "tanh" dependiong on the setting of "balanced".
    SignReducerLayer
    The type Sign reducer layer.
    SimpleActivationLayer<T extends SimpleActivationLayer<T>>
    A parent class for all stateless, univariate "activation" functions.
    SinewaveActivationLayer
    Calculates y=sin(x) in radians with signed unit amplitude.
    SoftmaxActivationLayer
    The classic "softmax" layer.
    Sparse01MetaLayer
    The type Sparse 01 meta layer.
    SqActivationLayer
    Specialized square activation function.
    StaticScalarLossLayer
    The type Static scalar loss layer.
    StdDevMetaLayer
    The type Std dev meta layer.
    SumInputsLayer
    Sums all inputs together, element-by-element, assuming they all have the same dimension.
    SumMetaLayer
    The type Sum meta layer.
    SumReducerLayer
    Sums all input values to produce a single-element output.
    TargetValueLayer
    Works as a single-input terminal loss function which compares the input with a preset constant target tensor.
    VariableLayer
    Acts as a mutable placeholder layer, whose inner implementation can be setByCoord and changed.
    WeightExtractor
    This input-less layer emits the weights of the referenced layer.
    WrapperLayer
    A base class for layers whose actual behavior is delegated.
